thread.title: Texas man breaks into home, showers, puts on Betty Boop pajamas
thread.title_full: Texas man breaks into home, showers, puts on Betty Boop pajamas

author: BRIAN LISI
title: Texas man breaks into home, showers, puts on Betty Boop pajamas
text:
Texas man breaks into home, takes shower, puts on Betty Boop pajamas Texas man breaks into home, showers, puts on Betty Boop pajamas The homeowners say they’ve never met Brad Edward Vaughan, who allegedly broke into their residence to enjoy some Betty Boop-branded merchandise. (WCSO/Courtesy Everett Collection)   12:49 PM 
Boop there he is. 
Police say they showed up to a suspected burglary to find their suspect in the bedroom wearing little else besides a pair of Betty Boop pajama bottoms. 
The Times Record News reports that Brad Edward Vaughan allegedly broke into a home in Wichita Falls, Texas, Sunday evening, where he cleaned up and threw on a comfy pair of pants featuring the giant-headed cartoon character from the 1930s. 
Upon entering, homeowners say they heard a man talking to himself in the shower, prompting them to call the Wichita Falls Police Department. Nothing says cozy up quite like a pair of pants bearing the image of a sexualized female cartoon character who started out as an anthropomorphic French poodle. (Amazon) 
"Officers entered the residence and found 37-year-old Brad Vaughan in a bedroom wearing only a pair of Betty Boop pajama bottoms belonging to one of the victims. His clothes were on the floor," police stated on their Facebook page. 
"The victims did not know Vaughan nor did he have permission to be there. He was arrested and charged with Burglary of a Habitation.” 
He's currently being held on $10,000 bail. Tags:
